title: Expanded Disability Status Scale (EDSS) / Functional Systems Score (FSS)
description: Describes severity of disability in MS patients based on functional systems assessment and ambulatory ability. The most widely used disability scale for multiple sclerosis.

parameters.name: ambulation
parameters.description: Ambulation Score (0-10 based on walking ability)

result.name: edss_score
result.description: EDSS score from 0 (normal neurological exam) to 10 (death due to MS)

ranges.interpretation: Normal neurological examination. All grade 0 in all functional systems.
No disability, minimal signs in one or more functional systems.
Minimal disability in one functional system.
Moderate disability in one functional system or mild disability in three or four functional systems though fully ambulatory.
Fully ambulatory without aid, self-sufficient, up and about some 12 hours a day despite relatively severe disability. Able to walk without aid or rest for 500m.
Ambulatory without aid or rest for about 200 meters; disability severe enough to impair full daily activities.
Intermittent or unilateral constant assistance (cane, crutch, brace) required to walk about 100 meters with or without resting.
Unable to walk beyond approximately 5 meters even with aid, essentially restricted to wheelchair.
Essentially restricted to bed or chair or perambulated in wheelchair, but out of bed most of day; retains many self-care functions.
Helpless bed patient; can communicate and eat.

references: Kurtzke JF. Rating neurologic impairment in multiple sclerosis: an expanded disability status scale (EDSS). Neurology. 1983 Nov;33(11):1444-52.
Slater RJ, LaRocca NG, Scheinberg LC. Development and testing of a minimal record of disability in multiple sclerosis. Ann N Y Acad Sci. 1984;436:453-68.

Fouad AM, Abdel Naseer M, Farghaly M, Hegazy MI. New algorithmic approach for easier and faster extended disability status scale calculation. Mult Scler J Exp Transl Clin. 2023 Feb 9;9(1):20552173231155055.
formula: EDSS 0-4: Based on Functional Systems scores. EDSS 4.5-9.5: Based primarily on ambulation and ability to perform activities of daily living.
notes: Must be administered by a trained neurologist
Functional systems are evaluated first, then EDSS is determined
Visual and bowel/bladder scores require conversion before EDSS calculation
Ambulation is the primary determinant for scores above 5.0
Exception: Five FS scores of grade 2 results in EDSS 5.0, not 3.5
